page.title: 01Hemswell Village
page.content: Hemswell lies below the limestone ridge & consists of a church & 92 houses built of stone or brick. 9 houses are empty, 20 are council houses & most of the rest are owner- occupied & have been modernised to a high standard. It is almost entirely residential. Most of the land lies on top of the cliff & is farmed by 10 different farmers of whom only 3 live here. There is a village hall, a maypole, playground, Post Office & Working Mens Club. A weekly bus goes to Gainsborough & a daily service to Lincoln & Scunthorpe. The population is 191 of whom 30 are children & 42 pensioners, 25 people live alone. There are also 22 mobile homes with 30 residents, a mobile library, butcher, fishman, baker & milkman visit the village & a doctor holds a weekly surgery.
